summary: ON 7/1/2010 AT APPROXIMATELY 2015 HOURS WHILE RIDING ON RT 522 MANALPAN NEW JERSEY THE FRAME ON MY 2003 RIDLEY MOTORCYCLE FAILED (COLLAPSED) AT THE WELD CAUSING THE BIKE TO COLLIDE WITH THE PAVEMENT CAUSING INJURIES TO MY NECK AND BACK. *TR

WHILE OPERATING MY 2003 RIDLEY MOTORCYCLE ON ROUTE 522 IN MANALAPAN NEW JERSEY, THE FRAME FAILED ON MY MOTORCYCLE CAUSING THE FRONT END OF THE BIKE TO HIT THE PAVEMENT AT WHICH POINT I WAS RIDING ON THE UNDERCARRIAGE OF THE VEHICLE CAUSING EXTENSIVE DAMAGE AND PERSONAL INJURY. I WAS  ABLE TO STEADY THE BIKE WITHOUT HAVING IT TO FLIP OVER, BRINGING IT TO A STOP.  I CALLED 911 AND A TOW TRUCK TO REPORT THE INCIDENT AND HAVE MY MOTORCYCLE TOWED BACK TO MY RESIDENCE. THIS FRAME FAILURE OCCURRED WITHOUT WARNING. *TR

THE CARS ON HILLSBOROUGH , SHELDON , AND WATERS ARE SPEEDING WAY TO FAST THEY DON'T FOLLOW PEDESTRIAN SIGNS AND IGNORE PEOPLE THAT ARE WALKING ACROSS THE STREET AND IN THE WESTBAY NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT OF GANG ACTIVITY ETC RACING SPEED. *TR

40+ YR OLD SEAT BELT STANDARDS - I STRONGLY URGE THE UPDATE OF SEAT BELT STANDARDS TO INCLUDE THE OBESE POPULATION . THIS WAS CONSIDERED IN 2003 BUT NOT ACTED UPON. THE DESIGN CURRENTLY SUPPORTS A MAXIMUM WEIGHT OF 215 LBS AND WHILE CONSIDERED A LARGE PERSON IN THE "60S, THE POPULATIONS WEIGHT HAS NOW  EXCEEDED THIS "MAXIMUM" WEIGHT BY FAR. THE COST OF REDESIGNING AND INSTALLING BELTS WOULD BE MOOT. A COMFORTABLE BELT WOULD ENCOURAGE ITS USE. TODAYS TECHNOLOGY CAN PROVIDE A SAFE AND COMFORTABLE BELT INEXPENSIVELY.    I IMPLORE YOU TO MANDATE A COMFORTABLE AND SAFE SEAT BELT FOR ALL PEOPLE IN ALL CARS,SUVS AND LIGHT TRUCKS.    THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONSIDERATION.    SINCERELY,  VICKY WEBER    BY THE WAY, THIS FORM WITH ITS MANDATORY FIELDS WAS DIFFICULT TO COMPLETE FOR THIS TYPE OF COMPLAINT/SUGGESTION.  *TR

MOTORCYCLE TRAILER WITH LESS THAN 5,000 MILES ON IT WENT   END OVER END AT SPEED WHEN THE TONGUE FAILED.  THE AXLE AND WHEEL HUBS ARE BENT BEYOND REPAIR. UNIT WAS OUT OF   WARRANTY BUT THIS IS OBVIOUSLY AN ENGINEERING DEFECT.  *TR

components: ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE
summary: (I HAVE A 2003 AUDI A4 1.8T)TODAY MY CHECK ENGINE LIGHT CAME ON AFTER DRIVING AT A SPEED OF 65MPH. I TOOK IT TO THE DEALER AND THEY TOLD ME THAT COIL #4 HAS FAILED AS WELL. THEY HAVE ALREADY REPLACED MY ENTIRE ENGINE HARNESS AND STATED THAT WAS THE CAUSE OF MY PREVIOUS COILS FAILING (COIL #S 1,2, AND 3). I HAVE ONLY HAD THE CAR SINCE APRIL 30, 2007 AND SINCE THEN IT WAS NECESSARY FOR ME TO REPLACE MY ENGINE HARNESS, COIL NUMBERS 1, 2, & 3, SOME SEALS, SOME HOSES, AND A FUEL PUMP. I BOUGHT AN AUDI FOR THE QUALITY AND RELIABLE BUT IT SOUNDS LIKE ILL BE GOING TO BMW OR MERCEDES FROM NOW ON. *TR

COMPLETE POWER FAILURE WHILE RIDING MOTORCYCLE AT SPEED.  DID NOT CRASH, RECOVERED FROM POWER LOSS BY HOLDING IN CLUTCH AND SHIFTING TO NEUTRAL.  UPON STOPPING, NO IGNITION POWER, NO POWER TO DASH, BATTERY HAS FULL CHARGE (OVER 90%), GAS WAS FULL. UPON RECOMMENDATION, I EXAMINED IGNITION WIRING HARNESS AND NOTED THAT A FOUR-PIN CONNECTOR HAD BURNED AND MELTED, APPARENTLY A COMMON PROBLEM WITH 2003 SUZUKI SV1000S MOTORCYCLES AS PER THIS WEBSITE:  HTTP://WWW.SV-PORTAL.COM/FORUMS/SHOWTHREAD.PHP?T=20730&PAGE=5&HIGHLIGHT=GREEN+CONNECTOR  THIS PROBLEM IS LIFE-THREATENING, AS IT CAN OCCUR WHILE VEHICLE IS IN MOTION AT FREEWAY SPEEDS!  *TR

2003.5 -2006 URAL MOTORCYCLES WITH OEM RUSSIAN ALTERNATORS FAIL WITHOUT WARNING.  MANUFACTURER WAS  AWARE OF PROBLEM, BUT REPAIR COSTS OVER 400.00.  MINE HAS FAILED TWICE, OTHERS HAVE HAD 8 FAILURES PRIOR TO FACTORY OUTSOURCING ALTERNATOR TO OTHER MANUFACTURERS.  MULTIPLE FAILURES HAVE BEEN REPORTED BY OWNERS ON MULTIPLE WEB SITE AND USER SUPPORT GROUPS.  MY LATEST FAILURE THIS MORNING HAPPENED IN TRAFFIC AT SPEED AND RESULTED IN THE REAR END LOCKING AND SKIDDING THE MOTORCYCLE.  THIS IS THE MOST COMMON OCCURANCE FOR THIS FAILURE.  *AK

I JUST PURCHASED A VAN AND NOT EVEN 3 WKS LATER I WAS DRIVING DOWN THE HWY WITH ALL OF MY KIDS IN THE CAR AND THE TREAD CAME OFF MY TIRE (THE TIRE DID NOT POP) HOWEVER, THE TREAD REALLY DAMAGED THE FRONT SIDE OF MY CAR LUCKILY I PULLED OVER RIGHT AWAY OR WHO KNOWS WHAT COULD OF HAPPENED. *TR
WHILE ENROUTE TO BRANSON MISSOURI, THE LEFT AXLE ON MY MOTORCYCLE TRAILER FAILED AND SNAPPED OFF CAUSING THE LEFT WHEEL TO TUCK UNDER THE TRAILER.  THIS CAUSED THE TRAILER TO SEVERELY SWERVE. *JB

RIDING A SNOWMOBILE,THEN NOTICING GAS LEAKING ONTO MY PANTS.THE GAS TANK FILLER NECK DEVELOPED A CRACK.  NO FAILURE OR FIRE DEVELOPED.  THE LEAK WAS PLUGGED WITH SILICON.  THE TANK IS STILL ON THE SNOWMOBILE.  MY NEXT DOOR NEIGHBOR HAS THE SAME MODEL AND LEAK AS MINE.  *NM

2003 SUZUKI TL1000R FUEL LEAK NEAR THE IGNITION SYSTEM CAUSED BY A BRACKET INSIDE THE FUEL TANK. VIBRATIONS HAVE CAUSED THE FUEL TANK TO CRACK ALLOWING FUEL TO LEAK ONTO THE IGNITION SYSTEM. THERE IS A SIMILAR RECALL ON THE SUZUKI SV1000 (NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER : 06V013000 ). MY TL1000R HAS THE SAME EXACT PROBLEM, I CONTACTED SUZUKI AND THEY OFFERED NO HELP.   *JB

I PURCHASED A MOTOR DRIVEN CYCLE ON THE APROX. DATE BELOW AND WOULD LIKE TO KNOW HOW I COULD HAVE IT INSPECTED TO SHOW THE DMV WHERE I LIVE(ALASKA) THAT IT MEETS FMVSS. IT HAS NO STICKER THAT I CAN LOCATE ON THE BIKE ANYWHERE AND NOTHING ON THE MCO WHICH HAS THE MANUFACTURER NAME OF CHINA JIALING INDUSTRY CO., LTD ON IT BUT NOTHING STATING THAT IT MEETS FMVSS STAMPED ON IT EITHER. IT HAS A 49CC MOTOR AND HAS ALL THE SAFETY EQUIPMENT AS SHOWN UNDER SECTION 571 OF THE NHTSA REGULATIONS. I WOULD LIKE TO KNOW HOW THIS BIKE COULD GET INTO THE U.S. PAST CUSTOMS WITHOUT SOMETHING STATING THAT IT MEETS FMVSS. I HAVE TRIED THE DEALER WHICH THEY ONLY HAVE A WEB SITE AND MY LOCAL DMV. I FEEL LIKE I'M JUST GETTING THE RUN AROUND AND JUST WANT TO BE ABLE TO RIDE MY BIKE LEGALLY ON THE ROAD. CAN YOU PLEASE HELP ME IN ANY WAY? I WOULD GREATLY APPRECIATE IT. THANK YOU.  *JB

WHILE PULLING MY 12.000 LB 5TH WHEEL I HAD TWO GOODYEAR TIRES, WRANGLER HT, LT 235 85R16, LOAD RANGE E, GO FLAT ON ME DUE TO TREAD SEPERATION.  IN BOTH CASES I HAD PULLED OFF THE ROAD AT A REST STOP OR GAS STATION AND NOTICED THE TIRES GOING FLAT .  HAD I NOT PULLED OVER AND STOPPED I BELIEVE THE TIRES WOULD HAVE BLOWN OR SHREADED.  THESE TWO TIRE PROBLEMS HAPPENED WITHIN THREE DAYS AND 400 MILES OF EACH OTHER.  THE TIRES HAD ABOUT 5,000 MILES ON THEM.  GOODYEAR TIRE STORES REPLACED THE TIRES AND SAID THEY SHOULD NOT HAVE SEPERATED.  I CARRIED 80LBS. COLD AIR PRESSURE.  *JB

DT*:  THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE HITCH UNIT ON THE MASTERTOW 80T DISENGAGED FROM THE BALL WHILE DRIVING AT 55 MPH.  THE HITCH UNIT SPEARED THE FIBERGLASS ON THE TOWING VEHICLE.  UPON INSPECTION, THE UNIT WAS FOUND TO BE UNDAMAGED.  HOWEVER, WHEN MOVED UP AND DOWN 3 TIMES, THE LATCH CAME OPEN A SECOND TIME.  THE UNIT WAS NOT INSPECTED BY A MECHANIC.  *AK

DT*: THE CONTACT STATED THREE OF THE SIX TIRES ON THE STOCK TRAILER HAD THREAD SEPARATION.  FOUR OF THE TIRES ON THE TRAILER ARE LOCATED ON THE GROUND AND TWO ARE SPARES.   ALL THREE OF THE TIRES WITH THE FAILURE WERE ON THE GROUND.  THE FIRST TIRE HAD THE FAILURE ON 08-30-2005 AT 4045 MILES, THE SECOND AND THIRD WAS ON 04-01-06 AT 1500 MILES LATER.  TWO OF THE TIRES REMAINED AT THE PROPER INFLATION AND ONE DEFLATED.  THE MANUFACTURER OF THE TIRES HAS BEEN ALERTED.  THE TIRES WERE GOODYEAR UNISTEEL TIRES G614RST.  THE TIRE LINE IS 23585R16.  THE TRAILER IS A 2003 FOURSTAR STOCK TRAILER.
TIRE DEFECTS LEADING TO FAILURE AND POTENTIAL HARM TO DRIVER. *JB

ON JUNE 13TH 2005 MY AUDI A6 2.7 T WAS SERVICED AT DESERT AUDI HERE IN LAS VEGAS. A 30,000 MILE SERVICE WAS CONDUCTED (@28,256) WHICH PER THEIR SERVICE MENU INCLUDED EXAMINING MY TIRES, SUSPENSION AND A VISUAL ASSESSMENT OF ALIGNMENT.  ON SEPTEMBER 14TH 2005 I HAD A LOW SPEED FRONT PASSENGER SIDE TIRE BLOW-OUT.  THE TIRE ACTUALLY COMPLETELY TORE APART ON THE INSIDE WALL OF THE TIRE AT THE TREAD MARGIN.  MY VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO THE AUDI DEALER AND THEY INDICATED THAT THEY DIDN'T SELL TIRES, THE CLOSEST TIRE STORE ALSO FOUND THAT THE OTHER FRONT TIRE HAD AN UNUSUAL WEAR PATTERN ON THE INSIDE WALL OF THE TIRE AND RECOMMENDED REPLACEMENT. THEY TOLD ME MY CAR WAS SEVERELY OUT OF ALIGNMENT, MILEAGE 30,258.  I TOOK MY AUDI BACK TO DESERT AUDI AND EXPLAINED WHAT HAD HAPPENED.  WITHOUT ACKNOWLEDGING HOW SIGNIFICANT TIRE WEAR WAS NOT NOTED <3 MONTHS AND < 2, 000 MILES BEFORE, THEY ASSESSED THE ALIGNMENT AND TOLD ME THERE WAS NO ALIGNMENT PROBLEM AND IN THEIR OPINION I HAD SOME BAD TIRES. NOW THE TIRES WERE THE ORIGINAL TIRES THAT CAME ON THE VEHICLE, DUNLOP HIGH SPEED RATED TIRES SPORT 9090-235/45ZR17-94Y.  THE DECISION ABOUT WHICH TIRES TO PUT ON VEHICLES SOLD OR LEASED IN THE US IN UNDOUBTEDLY WAS MADE BY SOMEONE OR BY A CONTRACTUAL ARRANGEMENT; I CERTAINLY WASN'T ASKED WHAT TIRES I WANTED ON MY AUDI.  UPON CONTACTING THE TIRE COMPANY THAT SOMEONE AT AUDI DECIDED TO USE AND ENTRUST THE OVERALL SAFETY OF THE VEHICLE TO, I EXPECTED SOME LEVEL OF SERVICE AND CONCERN OVER WHAT HAD HAPPENED. I MADE NUMEROUS PHONE CALLS (FILE# 792313, DUNLOP TIRE CORP). WAS SENT OVER TO A GOODYEAR TIRE DEALER AND WAS AGAIN TOLD THAT THE PROBLEM WAS WITH MY AUDI.  THE  TIRE CONTRACTOR DUNLOP/GOODYEAR EXPLAINED TO ME THAT THE AUDI  FACTORY CERTIFIED TECHNICIANS DON'T KNOW ANYTHING ABOUT CAR ALIGNMENTS AND THAT THEY WOULD NEED TO CHECK MY ALIGNMENT. THE ALIGNMENT WAS STILL FINE, SO THEY DECIDED IT WAS SOMETHING I DID AND ESSENTIALLY REFUSED TO OFFER ANY VIABLE SOLUTION. *JB

WHILE OPENING MY POP UP CHALET A FRAME TRAILER, THERE WAS A SLIGHT WIND WHICH TOOK THE FRONT SECTION OF THE ROOF AND BLEW IT COMPLETELY OVER TOWARD THE TONGUE OF THE TRAILER. THE ONLY DAMAGE NOTICED IS THE ALUMINUM EXTRUSION THAT SURROUNDS THE FRONT SECTION OF THE ROOF IS BENT IN A CONCAVE FASHION.  I CONTACTED CHALET AND THEY SAID SINCE IT'S OUT OF WARRANTY THEY AREN'T RESPONSIBLE FOR THE PROBLEM. I TOLD ANGIE, THE PERSON I WAS SPEAKING TO, THIS IS EITHER A SAFETY , DESIGN, MANUFACTURING OR ALL THE ABOVE PROBLEM AND THE WARRANTY PERIOD SHOULDN'T HAVE ANYTHING TO DO WITH IT. SHE SAID SHE WILL TELL HER BOSS.  AS IT TURNS OUT, THERE IS NO SAFETY DEVICE TO PREVENT THE ROOF FROM BLOWING OVER. THERE ARE TWO BUNGEE CORDS CONNECTED TO THE FRONT AND REAR ROOFS THAT SHOULD HELP, BUT SINCE MINE HAD ROTTED AWAY, THEY WERE GONE. TALKING TO ANGIE, SHE SAID THEY HAVE HAD ROOFS BLOW OVER EVEN WHEN THE BUNGEE CORDS WERE CONNECTED.  THERE IS NOTHING IN ANY OF THE PAPER WORK I RECEIVED THAT GIVES A WARNING ABOUT THE POSSIBILITY OF THE ROOF BLOWING OVER. I THINK I WAS JUST LUCKY THERE IS NO ADDITIONAL DAMAGE, NOR DID IT COMPLETELY DETACHED AND FLY AWAY.   I'VE WAITED APPROXIMATELY A YEAR TO REPORT THIS BECAUSE I DIDN'T KNOW WHO TO REPORT THIS TO, NOR DO I KNOW IF THIS IS A REPORTABLE PROBLEM. I JUST RETURNED FROM A TRIP AND HAD TO LOOK AT THE DAMAGE EVERY DAY AND GOT MADDER ABOUT IT EVERY DAY, SO I DECIDED I MUST DO SOMETHING ABOUT THIS.  I THOUGHT CHALET RV INC. WOULD SEE THEIR LIABILITY, BUT NO, AND NOW I'M HAVING TO FILE THIS COMPLAINT.  YOU DON'T LIST THIS COMPANY IN YOUR MANUFACTURE LIST, SO HERE IS THE INFORMATION:  CHALET RV INC.                                         725 SE FIRST AVE.                                          ALBANY, OR. 97321  (541)791-4610  (541)791-4618 FAX  WWW.CHALETRV.COM

MELTED CONNECTOR IN IGNITION HARNESS CAUSING COMPLETE FAILURE OF MOTORCYCLE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM. ALSO POSSIBLE FIRE HAZZARD. OTHER OWNERS HAVE CRASHED DUE TO IGNITION FAILURE WHILE RIDING!!! I HAVE DIGITAL PHOTOS OF THE MELTED CONNECTOR.  NOTE: VEHICLE IS A 2003 SUZUKI SV1000SK3 MOTORCYCLE - YOU DO NOT HAVE SUZUKI IN YOUR MOTORCYCLE DROP DOWN COLUMN!

DT: 2003 PACIFIC BAJA TRAILER FOR WEST WHITE SAILBOAT  HAS A DESIGN FLAW  FROM 2003 -PRESENT.  THERE HAS BEEN A MOVEMENT OF THE FENDER THAT PROTECTS THE BOAT AND THE TIRE FROM CONTACTING EACH OTHER.  AS A RESULT, THIS TRAILERS TIRE AND BOAT CAME IN CONTACT WITH ONE ANOTHER.  THERE IS A RISK FOR TIRE BLOWOUT.  THIS HAS NOT HAPPENED TO CONSUMER BUT FEELS THERE IS A RISK.  CONTACTED THE DEALER, WHO RESPONDED  THAT THE PROBLEM WAS WITH THE SAILBOAT MANUFACTURER, WHO MADE THE SPECS AND THEY ONLY FOLLOWED THEM.  CONSUMER MADE CORRECTIONS HIMSELF BY REMOVING THE EXISTING FENDERS AND INSTALLING WIDER FENDERS WITH FENDER BACKS TO STOP THIS BOAT AND TIRE RUB.  THIS SEEMED TO CORRECT THE PROBLEM AT THIS TIME.  THIS BAJA TRAILER IS MANUFACTURED BY PACIFIC TRAILERS. MODEL # G17SW3.  *AK

DT: THE CONTACT OWNS A 2003 KOMFORT TRAILER MANUFACTURED BY THOR. THE CONTACT COMPLAINED ABOUT  TIRE PROBLEMS.  ONE TIRE  BLEW OUT, CAUSING ANOTHER TIRE TO BLOW OUT. THE OTHER TWO TIRES HAD BULGES IN THEM BECAUSE OF THE TREAD. ALL OF THIS OCCURRED AT THE SAME TIME. THIS HAPPENED ON JULY 16TH 2005.  THE TIRES MANUFACTURER NANG KUNG RUBBER TIRE COMPANY. THE BRAND NAME WAS MISSION,  DOT #  WEHH2732003 LOAD D8PLY, AND TIRE SIZE  ST225/75R15. ON THE FRONT RIGHT IT BLEW  OUT SO BADLY THAT CONSUMER  WAS UNABLE TO GET ANY OF THE INFORMATION. ON THE REAR LEFT TIRE.  *AK  *JB

TIRE BLOWOUT (THREE DIFFERENT TIRES ON THREE DATES WITHIN TWO WEEKS OF EACH OTHER, ALL ON A TWO AXEL, 4 TIRE TRAILER, 3 TONS GVW. SAME TIRE MANUFACTURER, MAKE, MODEL, AND SIZE, TWO TIRES WHICH FAILED BOUGHT AT THE SAME TIME (OEM), ONE WAS A REPLACEMENT FOR A BLOWN OUT TIRE BOUGHT IN MAY 2005)
THE ELASTIC PADDING , CONNECTING THE STRAP WAS TAKEN OFF BY THE CHILD AND THE CHILD PROCEEDED TO PLACE IT  AROUND HIS NECK.      COSCO  22208WAL.  *NM    *BF

FAILURE OF MANUAL TRANSMISSION; INTERMITTENT  (1) UPON SHIFTING FROM 1ST TO 2ND GEAR AND SOMETIMES 3RD, THE CLUTCH DOES NOT ENGAGE AND "GRINDS" ITSELF TO GET IN GEAR OR REMAINS IN NEUTRAL.*AK  (2) THE ABNORMAL WEAR ON MY SYNCHROS AND GEAR SET WILL CAUSE IT/THEM TO FAIL AT AN INCREASE FASTER THAN INDUSTRY STANDARD YET PAST MY WARRANTY DATE.  (3) HONDA COULD NOT DUPLICATE THE PROBLEM; HOWEVER, I WAS REFUSED TO ATTEMPT TO DUPLICATE IT THE FAILURE (AS HONDA'S TECHNIQUE WAS BIASED). THE SYNCHROS AND/OR ENTIRE TRANSMISSION NEEDS TO BE REPLACED AND WARRANTIED AS A NEW ITEM.  (4) AS A MANUFACTUROR'S DEFECT IS THE CAUSE OF THIS FAILURE, NO COST SHOULD BE ATTRIBUTED TO THE OWNER, RENEWAL OF THE ENTIRE LENGTH OF THE DRIVETRAIN WARRANTY FROM THE DATE OF REPLACEMENT (E.G., 3 YEARS/60,000 MILES).

components: ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,POWER TRAIN,ELECTRICAL SYSTEM
summary: LYON INVESTIGATIONS, INC.  AFTER INSPECTING THE PRIMARY DRIVE ASSEMBLY ON A 2003 ULTRA CHOPPER IT HAS COME TO MY ATTENTION THAT THE NUT SECURING THE FRONT SPROCKET SPACER IS NOT TORQUED SUFFICENTLY TO KEEP THE ROTOR AND ITS WASHER FROM MOVING. THIS MOVEMENT EVENTUIALLY CAUSES THE SPLINES TO WEAR IN THE ROTOR AND SPACER  PREMATURELY. THIS CAN CAUSE THE ENGINE TO STOP RUNNING WHEN THE SPLINES IN TEH ROTOR STRIP COMPLETELY.*AK

I WISH TO FILE A COMPLAINT CONCERNING OUR SEA-DOO.  THE HULL IS DEFECTIVE AND HAS FALLEN APART.  WE HAVE HAD NO LUCK DEALING WITH THE DEALER WHO SOLD US THE CRAFT OR THE MAKER BOMBARDIE.  OUR INSURANCE HAD THE CRAFT LOOKED AT AND DETERMINED A THAT THERE IS A DEFECT. *AK

THERE IS A DEFECT IN THE HULL OF OUR 2003 SEA-DOO.  IT HAS FALLEN APART.  OVER 90% OF THE HULL IS GONE, EXPOSING THE FIBERGLASS.  A MARINE SURVEYOR AS EVALUATED THE HULL SUGGESTING THAT IT WAS NOT CURED PROPERLY.  BOMBARDIER HAS DENIED THIS CLAIM.*AK

I HAVE HAD TWO TIRES WITH TREAD SEPARATION ON TWO SEPARATE OCCASIONS ON MY 5TH WHEEL TRAILER.  TIRES ARE ABOUT 3 YEARS OLD, BUT HAVE VERY LITTLE WEAR.  I ESTIMATE THEY HAVE ABOUT 3500 MILES ON THEM  TIRES ARE CARLISLE RADIAL ST 225/75R15.   *LA

WHILE TRAVELING NORTH ON I95 AROUND MILE MARKER 120, I HAD A BLOWOUT ON A 5TH WHEEL SUNNYBROOK RV WHILE IN TOW. THE TIRE WAS A GOODYEAR, 235/85/R16, WRANGLER HT, LOAD RANGE E, DOT 0903. I PURCHASED THIS SUNNYBROOK ON 4/10/2003 AND THE TIRE HAD LESS THAN 4,000 MILES USE AT TIME OF INCIDENT. THE BLOWOUT WAS ON THE INSIDE MOUNTING OF THE WHEEL AND THE TIRE PARTED 360 DEGREES WHERE THE SIDEWALL WAS AFFIXED TO THE TREAD. WEATHER CONDITIONS WERE RAINING AND APPX. 60 DEGREES. ALL TIRES HAD JUST BEEN CHECKED FOR PROPER PRESSURE 3 HOURS PRIOR TO THIS INCIDENT. THERE HAVE BEEN 4 OTHER INCIDENTS WITH THE 03 SUNNYBROOK 5TH WHEEL RVS USING THIS SAME GOODYEAR TIRE THAT ARE MEMBERS OF THE CLUB I AM A MEMBER OF. ONE OF OUR MEMBERS IS IN THE PROCESS OF COMPILING EVERYONE'S INFORMATION TO SUBMIT TO SUNNYBROOK AND ALSO TO GOODYEAR. I EMAILED GOODYEARS CONSUMER RELATIONS THROUGH THEIR WEBSITE TO REPORT THIS INCIDENT AND A TONY SETTIMIO, REFERENCE # 684381 STATED THAT THERE HAVE BEEN NO UNUSUAL PROBLEMS WITH THIS SUBJECT TIRE. BUT YET, I GO ON THE NHTSA WEBSITE AND THERE HAVE BEEN 44 HITS SINCE 2000.  *JB

MANY PICKUPS AND SUVS HAVE THEIR HEADLIGHTS PLACED SO HIGH,THAT EVEN WHEN USING LOW BEAM,THE LIGHT BLINDS APPROACHING PASSENGER CAR DRIVER,AS THEY SIT MUCH LOWER THAN THE TRUCK/SUV LIGHT. EXCEPT FOR AESTHETICS,THE MANUFACTURERS COULD READILY LOWER THE HEIGTH OF HEADLIGHT LOCATION.I WISH THAT YOUR AGENCY WOULD SET LIMITS ON HEADLIGHT HEIGTH,SO THAT THIS SAFETY HAZARD WOULD BE ELIMINATED.*AK

WE PURCHASED A 52 FT ENCLOSED CAR HAULER FROM TWIN CITIES FEATHERLITE IN ELKO, MN, WHICH WAS MANUFACTURED OUT OF J-N-L'S CARGO, PO BOX 130, BRISTOL, IN 46507.  IT HAS BEEN CRACKING AROUND THE WELDS AT THE GOOSENECK OF THE TRAILER.  WE HAVE SPOKE WITH 2 SEPARATE WELD TECHNICIANS (NEB, AZ) AND BOTH STATED THAT THIS WAS A DESIGN FLAW.  THE ONE FROM AZ HAD ALSO STATED THAT HE WOULD NOT PERFORM THE WORK NECESSARY TO FIX THIS BECAUSE THE PROBLEM WOULD CONTINUE TO TAKE PLACE AND HE DID NOT WANT TO TAKE OVER THE LIABILITY FOR THIS PROBLEM.  THIS HAD HAPPENED WITH THE PREVIOUS TRAILER WE PURCHASED FROM THE SAME COMPANIES, HOWEVER WE TRADED THE OTHER ONE IN TO GET OUT OF THE PROBLEM (OWNED 10 MONTHS WHEN CRACKING TOOK PLACE)  THE NEW TRAILER HAS BEEN IN OUR POSSESSION BARELY A MONTH AND THEY CLAIM THIS HAS NEVER HAPPENED BEFORE,  I'M NOT SURE HOW I FEEL ABOUT THINKING FOR THE LUCK OF THE DRAW IT'S ONLY HAPPENED TO US TWICE. WE USE THIS TRAILER AS SPECIFIED WE ONLY HAUL 2 CARS AT A TIME AND DO NOT EVEN UTILIZE THE EXCESS SPACE IN WHICH IT SUPPOSED TO BE DESIGNED FOR.  WE HAVE INVESTED $32,000 INTO THIS TRAILER AND SHOULD BE ABLE TO USE IT.  THE COMPANY WANTS US TO BRING IT TO THEM IN INDIANA WE ARE IN AZ AT THIS TIME AND DO NOT WANT TO CHANCE A DEATH HAZARD SHOULD IT HAPPENED TO BREAK ALL THE WAY.  THE WELD SPECIALISTS ALONG WITH MYSELF BELIEVE THIS IS A SAFETY HAZARD.  *LA

GARDEN PARKING GARA AGE -   LICENSE 1140965    PHONE 212-947-4098. NO SUMMARY LISTED THAT INCLUDES COMPONENTS.  *AK    ADDRESS - 386 EIGHTH AVE. NEW YORK, NEW YORK 10001    ON THE RUSH HOUR EVENING OF NOV. 10TH, THE PARKING GARAGE MANAGER WAS BACKING  A CAR INTO THE OPEN LOT OF THE PARKING GARAGE AND PRACTICALLY INJURED 2 PEDESTRIANS  WALIKING PAST ON THE WAY TO PENNSYLVANIA TRAIN STATION AT APPROXIMATELY 5:30 P.M.    THE PARKING MANAGER WAS TOLD THAT HE ALMOST HIT TWO PERSONS AND HE REPLIED THAT  THEY SHOULD "LOOK WHERE THEY ARE GOING."  HE ALSO SAID "TOO BAD" I'M JUST DOING MY JOB."  THE POLICE WERE NOTIFIED WITH A 911 EMERGENCY PHONE CALL AND THE POLICE ARRIVED AND EXPLAINED TO THE GARAGE ATTENDANT THAT "PEDESTRIANS ALWAYS HAVE THE  RIGHT OF WAY BY LAW"  OBVIOUSLY, THIS GARAGE DOES NOT HONOR THIS LAW.    PLEASE INVESTIGATE THIS INCIDENT, AS I AM CERTAIN THAT THIS IS NOT THE FIRST OCCURENCE.    SINCERELY,    MS. CARTER

A HOT DOG VENDING TRAILER  (CART) I PURCHASED , ROLLED OVER AND CRASHED WHILE I WAS MAKING A LEFT HAND TURN AT A SPEED OF 20 MPH  BECAUSE OF A DESIGN ERROR. THE CART RESTS DIRECTLY ABOVE THE WHEELS WITH ONLY 1 INCH OF SPACE BETWEEN THE UNDERSIDE OF THE CART AND THE WHEELS. WHILE MAKING A TURN,  THE CART LEANED ONTO THE RIGHT HAND TIRE, CAUSING IT TO LOCK UP AND FLIP THE CART ONTO ITS SIDE WITH ENOUGH FORCE THAT IT SNAPPED THE SAFETY CHAIN.  PRIOR TO THIS INCIDENT I HAD NOTIFIED THE MANUFACTURER THAT I HAD SOME CONCERNS WITH THE LACK OF SUFFICIENT CLEARANCE BECAUSE THE CART WAS RUBBING ON THE WHEELS. THE OWNER OF THE COMPANY THAT MANUFACTURED THIS TRAILER TOLD ME ON THREE SEPARATE OCCASIONS THAT HE WOULD COME TO MY RESIDENCE AND ADDRESS THIS ISSUE AS WELL SOME OTHER DEFECTS; BUT FAILED  TO SHOW UP EACH TIME. THE TRAILER FLIPPED OVER 30 DAYS FROM THE DATE I RECEIVED IT.  APPROXIMATELY 5 DAYS AFTER THE ACCIDENT, THE COMPANY OWNER SHOWED UP AT MY RESIDENCE AND AGREED IN A HAND WRITTEN STATEMENT THAT IT WAS INDEED A DESIGN ERROR THAT CAUSED THE CART TO BE UNSAFE AND TO FLIP OVER. HE ALSO AGREED IN THIS STATEMENT THAT HE WOULD BUILD ME A NEW CART WITH A WIDER AXLE TO ADDRESS THIS SAFETY ISSUE AND  RECTIFY THE SITUATION. HE HAS SINCE BALKED AT BUILDING ME A NEW CART,AND HAS REFUSED TO ACCEPT ANY RESPONSIBILITY FOR REPAIRING THE CART I PRESENTLY  OPERATE. HE WILL NOT EVEN TAKE MY PHONE CALLS. THIS COMPANY MANUFACTURES SEVERAL MODELS OF HOT DOG CARTS WHICH ARE SIMILAR TO MINE AND  WHICH ARE INHERENTLY UNSAFE. MY HOPE IS THAT AN ENGINEER CAN REVIEW THEIR PLANS AND THAT IT CAN BE REQUESTED OF THIS COMPANY THAT THEY DO WHAT IS NECESSARY TO MAKE THE CONVEYANCE THEY MANUFACTURED, SAFE AND ROAD WORTHY.*AK

HEADLIGHTS TOO BRIGHT AND DRIVERS DRIVING WITH BRIGHT LIGHTS ON ALL CARS AND TRUCKS SHOULD BE REQUIRED TO BE MADE WITH AUTOMATIC HEADLIGHT DIMMERS. CARS IN THE 50'S & 60'S HAD THIS. ALSO ALL CARS AND TRUCKS SHOULD BE REQUIRED TO HAVE A TIMER ON THE FOG/ROAD LIGHTS SO THEY DON'T BLIND DRIVERS ,THEY WOULD GO OUT AFTER 10 MINUTES.  *LA

A TRAILER WHEEL DEVELOPED A SLOW LEAK AT THE WELD CONNECTING THE RIM TO THE BOLT FLANGE.  THIS COULD CAUSE THE WHEEL TO SEPARATE IF THE WELD FAILED.  VEHICLE:  2003 MONTANA 3760RL BY KEYSTONE RV CO.  *LA

A TRAILER WHEEL DEVELOPED A SLOW LEAK AT THE WELD CONNECTING THE RIM TO THE BOLT FLANGE.  THIS COULD CAUSE THE WHEEL TO SEPARATE IF THE WELD FAILED.  VEHICLE:  2003 MONTANA 3760RL BY KEYSTONE RV CO.  THIS WAS 2 SEPARATE INCIDENTS.  *LA

AS NOTICED, ON MOST NEW VEHICLES THE STEERING IS EXTREMELY TIGHT.  THE MOVEMENT OF THE STEERING WHEEL EITHER ON TO THE LEFT OR ON TO THE RIGHT WILL CAUSE AN EXTREME RESPONSE.  I BELIEVE THAT THIS CAUSES ROLLING OVER OF THE VEHICLE.    *LA

COUPLER OF TRAILER NOT WELDED PROPERLY TO FRAME. COUPLER CAME PARTIALLY DISENGAGED FROM TRAILER CAUSING A VERY HAZARDOUS SITUATION. TRAILER WAS A HAULMARK, MODEL # TS612SA. THIS VEHICLE INFORMATION WAS NOT A CHOICE IN VEHICLE INFORMATION, SO IT WAS PUT IN THIS BOX.   *NLM

THE BLINDING NATURE OF THE HEADLIGHTS USED ON SOME NEWER VEHICLES IS APPARENT TO ANYONE DRIVING EITHER DURING THE DAY OR NIGHT.  AT NIGHT, ESPECIALLY, IT IS AN EXTREME HAZARD WHICH CLEARLY WILL RESULT IN AN UNACCEPTABLE RISK OF INJURY AND DEATH.  FAILURE TO ADDRESS THIS ISSUE NOW WILL RESULT IN A PROLIFERATION OF THIS TYPE OF LIGHTING AND AT THAT POINT CORRECTIVE ACTION WILL BE  MORE DIFFICULT TO IMPLEMENT.

THE NEW XENON HEADLAMPS BEING USED ON SOME CARS NOW ARE A HAZARD TO ME.  THE LIGHT IS ALMOST PAINFUL TO MY EYES AND DEFIINITELY MAKES IT DIFFICULT FOR ME TO SEE WELL WHEN THEY ARE COMING AT ME.  I THINK THEY SHOULD BE OUTLAWED.   *PH

MY FATHER PURCHASED AN ATX 90 AND WAS TOLD IT TOOK AWHILE TO WARM UP WHEN COLD, WELL IT ALSO TAKES AWHILE TO WARM UP WHEN IT IS WARM OUTSIDE. THE COULD CAUSE AN INJURY TO CHILDREN THAT RIDE THIS QUAD IF IT WERE TO STALL.*AK

DURING/AFTER A RAINSTORM ON 6/13/03, I FOUND WATER COMING THROUGH MY STEREO SPEAKER IN THE MASTER BEDROOM CEILING (STREET SIDE).  I PURCHASED THIS TRAILER ON 4/21/03 FROM WALNUT RIDGE FAMILY TRAILER SALES, INC.  MY CONCERN IS WITH THE ELECTRICAL HAZARD THIS CONDITION POSES.  THE WATER DAMAGE TO THE INTERNAL ROOF STRUCTURE IS ALSO OF GREAT CONCERN.   *JB

I PURCHASED A 2003 KEYSTONE COUGAR 294RLS FROM WALNUT RIDGE ON 4/21/03.  FIRST DAY USING THE TRAILER, 5/25/03, I SAT DOWN IN THE SWIVEL CHAIR (CHAIR CLOSEST TO REAR DOOR), AND THE CHAIR IMMEDIATELY FELL OVER, SENDING ME TO THE FLOOR.  UPON INVESTIGATION, I FOUND THAT THE LEGS (BASE) OF THE CHAIR ONLY HAD ONE (1) SCREW HOLDING THEM TO THE REST OF THE CHAIR.  THE REST OF THE SCREWS (4-6) WERE MISSING.  *JB
COSCO MODEL # 22-010 PAW; THE SEAT SLIDES WHILE DRIVING AND HAS FLIPPED ON ITS SIDE WHILE MAKING TURNS.  *AK

IMPROPER PLACEMENT OF A MOUNTING BRACKET RESULTED IN TOO LITTLE CLEARANCE BETWEEN THE TIRE AND FENDER ON MY MOTORCYCLE TRAILER.  THE TIRE RUBBED AGAINST THE FENDER, CAUGHT THE LEAD EDGE OF THE FENDER, AND RIPPED THE FENDER AWAY RESULTING IN A BLOWOUT ON THE TRAILER.  THIS OCCURED ON INTERSTATE 20 IN HEAVY TRAFFIC.  MY MOTORCYCLE WAS ON THE TRAILER AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT.  THE MANUFACTURER ACKNOWLEDGES THE DESIGN FLAW WITH THE PLACEMENT OF THE BRACKET, BUT CONTINUES TO SELL THE TRAILERS WITHOUT ADVISING CUSTOMERS OF THIS ISSUE.

I AM VERY CONCERNED ABOUT THE LIMITING OF THE ALCOHOL LEVELS THAT WE SEE OCCURING IN MANY STATES. THE STATISTICS USED BY THE NHTSA ARE FLAWED. WHEN AN ACCIDENT IS CONSIDERED ALCOHOL RELATED, THE DRIVER CAUSING THE ACCIDENT DOES NOT HAVE TO BE THE ONE IMPAIRED. WHEN LOOKING AT LAST YEARS STATISTICS, THEY ARE HIGHER BECAUSE THEY WERE FOR ONE DAY. THE THREE PREVIOUS YEARS HAD THE ADVANTAGE OF HAVING THREE DAYS TO AVERAGE OUT. THE NUMBERS FROM THE LAST TEN YEARS HAVE BEEN RELATIVELY FLAT WITH A UP OR DOWN OF 10 PERCENT. ALSO, WHEN ACCIDENTS ARE INVOLVED, IT ISN'T THE .008 LEVEL PEOPLE THAT ARE INVOLVED, IT IS MORE OFTEN THE .025 PEOPLE. I AGREE THAT TRULY IMPAIRED PEOPLE SHOULD BE PUT IN JAIL. BUT REMOVING THE FREEDOMS FROM PEOPLE WHO HAVE ONE DRINK AN HOUR IS LUDICROUS!*AK

THE MOTORCYCLE HEADLIGHTS ARE A GLARING HAZARD. STANDARDS SHOULD BE SET TO KEEP THEM WITHIN SAFETY STANDARDS.  SUV'S AND BIG PICKUPS FOLLOWING AT NIGHT ARE A BIG DISTRACTION. ONE CAN'T AVOID THE HUGE GLARE IN THE SIDE VIEW MIRRORS. THESE VEHICLES SHOULD BE REQUIRED TO HAVE LOWER HEADLIGHTS. HIGH INTENSITY ARE TERRIBLE TOO.  *NLM

CONTINUAL GLARE FROM SUV AND SPORTS OR PSEUDO SPORTS VEHICLES WITH HIGH HEADLIGHTS, GLARING FOG LIGHTS, OR FOUR SETS OF LIGHTS THAT ARE TURNED ON AND APPROXIMATE THE HIGH BEAMS OF MOST OTHER CARS. THIS GLARE IS AT TIMES VERY DANGEROUS AND MAKES FOR VERY POOR VISIBILITY AND A HIGH POSSIBILITY OF WRECKS ESPECIALLY DURING BAD WET OR SNOWY WEATHER.   *NLM

QUESTION: IS THERE ANY ACTIONS OR EVALUATIONS TAKING PLACE ON AUTO HEADLIGHTS?  I FIND THE NEW HEADLIGHTS TO BE OVERLY BRIGHT, DISTRACTING AND AT TIMES BLINDING.  SOME OF THEM ARE EQUIVALENT TO SOMEBODY DRIVING WITH THEIR HIGH-BEAMS ON.  I HAVE HEARD NUMEROUS OTHER PEOPLE COMPLAIN - FOR THE PERSON BEHIND THE WHEEL THEY ARE GREAT.  FOR THE PERSON SEEING THEM HEAD-ON THEY POSE A SERIOUS SAFETY RISK.   *NLM
I FIND THESE HID HEADLIGHTS VERY BLINDING AND COULD CAUSE AN ACCIDENT. THEY SHOULD NOT BE ALLOWED ON AUTOS PERIOD!    *NLM

AS A RESULT OF A BID RECENTLY RECEIVED BY THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY FOR 175 SCHOOL VEHICLES, IT CAME TO OUR ATTENTION THAT VEHICLES PROPOSED TO BE MANUFACTURED BY U.S. BUS CORPORATION, 3 PAT MALONE DR., PO BOX 329, SUFFERN, NY DO NOT APPEAR TO COMPLY WITH FMVSS 301 FOR FUEL SYSTEM INTEGRITY.  WHILE THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY DISQUALIFIED THEIR BID, U.S. BUS CORPORATION HAS SOLD A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF SUCH NON-COMPLIANT VEHICLES AND CONTINUES TO OFFER THEM.  THE VEHICLES IN QUESTION ARE SCHOOL BUSES WITH CAPACITIES BETWEEN 16 AND 30 PASSENGERS, AND WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE VARIATIONS, BUILT WITH FLAT FLOORS.  THE VIOLATION APPLIES WHEN THESES BODIES ARE MOUNTED ON CHEVROLET AND GMC CUTAWAY VAN MODELS G315, 318,319 WITH OPTION B3D (SCHOOL BUS EQUIPMENT PACKAGE).  WHILE THESE CHASSIS ARE CERTIFIED BY GM FOR COMPLIANCE WITH FMVSS 301, THEIR CERTIFICATION ONLY APPLIES PROVIDED THAT THE HEIGHT OF THE BODY FLOOR DOES NOT EXCEED 110 MM ABOVE THE TOP OF THE FRAME.  THE FLOOR HEIGHT OF BUSES BUILT WITH A FLAT FLOOR ON THESE CHASSIS SIGNIFICANTLY EXCEEDS 110 MM.  THUS, SCHOOL BUSES BUILT WITH FLAT FLOORS BUILT UPON THESE CHASSIS ARE REQUIRED TO HAVE BEEN TESTED FOR COMPLIANCE WITH FMVSS 301.  ACCORDING TO MR. TOM VACLAVIK OF UPFITTER INTEGRATION GROUP, THE ONLY SUCH TESTING OF WHICH THEY ARE AWARE TO CERTIFY COMPLIANCE WITH FMVSS 301 OF FLAT FLOOR SCHOOL BUSES MOUNTED ON THESE CHASSIS IS:  1.SHARED TESTING PERFORMED BY A CONSORTIUM OF GIRARDIN, BLUE BIRD, THOMAS, CORBEIL AND GM, COORDINATED BY THE NTEA.  THE RESULTS OF THESE TESTS AND MODIFICATIONS REQUIRED FOR COMPLIANCE WAS PROPRIETARY TO THESE PARTICIPANTS.  2.  INDEPENDENT TESTING PERFORMED BY COLLINS BUS.  THERE ARE A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF SUCH SCHOOL BUSES MANUFACTURED BY U.S. BUS CORPORATION IN OPERATION, WHICH APPARENTLY HAVE NOT BEEN TESTED AND PROPERLY CERTIFIED FOR COMPLIANCE WITH THIS REQUIREMENT FOR FUEL SYSTEM INTEGRITY.  WE BELIEVE THIS MATTER REQUIRES INVESTIGATION.   *NLM
